content: crochet net produce sack pattern by janine paris​ | ​1 ​of​ 6 crochet net produce sack ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ ​ the base of this simple produce bag has 2 increase rounds once the increases are worked the bag body is completed in a spiral rather than joined at the end of each round both for convenience and looks these bags do add a bit of weight to produce especially if you re using a worsted yarn so make sure to weigh produce out of the bag if you re concerned with the potential increase in cost to items paid for by weight want a larger or smaller bag want a deeper or shallower bag use a heavier or lighter gauge yarn add or remove row from the body of the bag or add another increase round before starting the body you can also lace in a twill or grosgrain ribbon around the top if you d like to completely close your bags experiment with what works for you page 6 is a printer-friendly version ​ p​ lease don t sell this free pattern it s available for download on ravelry crochet net produce sack pattern by janine paris​ | ​2 ​of​ 6 materials & notions ● approximately 60 grams of dk weight cotton yarn ​i used sugar bush cabot from my stash for the pictured sample i also like southern bales fingering from stony hill fiber arts for this project ● us size b or 2 25mm crochet hook or size appropriate for your yarn ● clip-in stitch marker ● tapestry needle crochet net produce sack
